title: The naval-gazing Nobel prize is failing to face up to our existential challenges
text:
This outdated lifetime achievement award is distracting scientists at a crucial point in our planet's history

Nobel prize week is science’s version of the Oscars. It’s a chance for researchers everywhere to gather round, hope their favourite discovery will get the nod, then gripe endlessly that their area has been overlooked "again". And yet, as the first prize was dolled out to three recipients earlier today – including Briton Sir Peter Ratcliffe – I doubt most people even noticed.

You’d think news of a British Nobel prize winner would be trumpeted across the land. Afraid not. Nobel prizes rarely get that kind of attention; usually if any mention is made, it’s because the committee has finally...
